item.title: 2023 Book Recommendation List
item.description: Please note: These are my thoughts on the books at the time that I read them and wrote about it. My opinions change with time, with experience, etc. These are not gospel on what I think of a book - they are snapshots of a particular time. The list The image is ordered by the date of publication, not by any particular rating system. I will, however, share with you what I rated each book as.

item.title: Debut novel - beta reading signup
item.description: This is a short and sweet post. I am looking for people interested in beta-reading my debut novel. Having a good group of beta-readers will allow me to make sure it’s as good as it can be before I send it to editors. You can get more information and sign up to be a beta reader here (beta reading signup is now closed.) I look forward to hearing from you.

item.title: Why This Blog Exists
item.description: Back in 2020, when I was trying to make the best of my career in tech, I built myself a website using a technology called GatsbyJS. It wasn’t particularly well designed, but I did it from scratch, and I was proud of how it turned out. You can still look at the code for it here. 1 I had plans to use that website as a showcase for myself. I shared my r√©sum√© there.

item.title: 2022 Book Recommendation List
item.description: I get asked for book recommendations a lot, mostly by friends of mine who know I spend an inordinate amount of time reading. This year, I thought it would be nice to have a centralized place I could point people to. I would also like to take this as an opportunity to reflect on this year’s readings and collate my thoughts on the books I’ve read. It’s interesting to come back to them years later and notice how your thoughts on books evolve with your aging and shifts in perception - this way I’ll have a snapshot of what I thought of them when I first read them, which will be like a brain photograph when I’ve well forgotten what I read this year.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Review: Do nomads dream of organic hearts?
item.description: A few words on the buzz This is sort of an editorial note. Please skip it if you just want the review. Cyberpunk 2077 is, as of the date of writing this, the first single-player game to reach 1 million concurrent players on Steam, as well as the first game to ever get that achievement on the same day it got released. It is, by and large, the biggest single-player game in Steam history to date, and that‚Äôs not even counting consoles, GOG, and the Epic Games Store.
